projectName: Making AI Reports More Reliable: A Technical Guide from the Trenches

scenes.title: Introduction - The AI Reporting Challenge
scenes.narration: If you're working with AI to generate reports, you've probably faced this frustrating reality: your AI system works sometimes, but not consistently. As someone who's run an AI consulting agency for over a year, I've seen this challenge across every industry - from startups to cybersecurity firms. Today, I'll share the practical solutions I've discovered to make AI reporting truly reliable.
scenes.visualDescription: Show title card with professional tech background, then transition to author image with overlay text showing consulting experience statistics

scenes.title: Quick Wins - The Foundation
scenes.narration: Let's start with the simple fixes that deliver immediate results. First, always format your data in markdown - LLMs are trained on it and respond better. Second, write crystal-clear prompts. Just like humans, AI gets confused by vague instructions. And third, choose the right model for your specific task. GPT-4 isn't always the answer - sometimes Gemini's 2-million token context window is exactly what you need for detailed reports.
scenes.visualDescription: Split-screen showing markdown table formatting vs plain text, then animated comparison of different AI models with context window sizes

scenes.title: Smart Prompting Techniques
scenes.narration: Here's a game-changer: add the phrase 'explain your reasoning step by step' to your prompts. This technique, called Chain-of-Thought prompting, dramatically improves accuracy. Also, include few-shot examples - show the AI what good outputs look like. These examples guide the model toward the responses you actually want.
scenes.visualDescription: Before/after comparison showing AI responses with and without chain-of-thought prompting, followed by examples of few-shot prompting with sample inputs and desired outputs

scenes.title: The Power of Evaluation
scenes.narration: Want to know the secret to consistently improving your AI system? Build an evaluation pipeline. Create a dataset with sample inputs and expected outputs, then design metrics to score your AI's performance. This isn't just testing - it's optimization. You can automatically generate better prompts and measure improvement over time.
scenes.visualDescription: Flowchart animation showing evaluation pipeline: input queries → AI processing → output scoring → prompt optimization → improved results

scenes.title: The Reliability Mathematics
scenes.narration: Here's the crucial insight most people miss: complexity kills reliability. If each AI call has a 95% success rate, but your system makes 10 calls, your overall reliability drops to just 60%. Every additional API call exponentially reduces your system's dependability. Design for simplicity - can you solve the problem in 2 calls instead of 3? That's not just efficiency, that's exponentially better reliability.
scenes.visualDescription: Mathematical visualization showing probability calculations: 95% success rate across multiple calls, with animated graph showing exponential reliability decline

scenes.title: Your Action Checklist
scenes.narration: Ready to implement these improvements? Here's your checklist: Use markdown formatting and clear prompts. Choose the right model and optimize settings. Apply chain-of-thought prompting with examples. Build evaluation pipelines to measure and improve performance. And most importantly, simplify your system - fewer API calls mean exponentially better reliability. These aren't just theories - they're battle-tested solutions from real client projects.
